55
56// Sorted, disjoint and non-overlapping memory regions. A region is of the
57// form [start, end). So there's no [start, end), [end, other_end),
58// because that should have been reduced to [start, other_end).
59class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE DisjointAllocationPool final {
60 public:
61 MOVE_ONLY_WITH_DEFAULT_CONSTRUCTORS(DisjointAllocationPool);
62 explicit DisjointAllocationPool(base::AddressRegion region)
63 : regions_({region}) {}
64
65 // Merge the parameter region into this object. The assumption is that the
66 // passed parameter is not intersecting this object - for example, it was
67 // obtained from a previous Allocate. Returns the merged region.
68 base::AddressRegion Merge(base::AddressRegion);
69
70 // Allocate a contiguous region of size {size}. Return an empty region on
71 // failure.
72 base::AddressRegion Allocate(size_t size);
73
74 // Allocate a contiguous region of size {size} within {region}. Return an
75 // empty region on failure.
76 base::AddressRegion AllocateInRegion(size_t size, base::AddressRegion);
77
78 bool IsEmpty() const { return regions_.empty(); }
79
80 const auto& regions() const { return regions_; }
81
82 private:
83 std::set<base::AddressRegion, base::AddressRegion::StartAddressLess> regions_;
84};
85
86class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE WasmCode final {
87 public:
88 enum Kind { kWasmFunction, kWasmToCapiWrapper, kWasmToJsWrapper, kJumpTable };
89
90 static constexpr Builtin GetRecordWriteBuiltin(SaveFPRegsMode fp_mode) {
91 switch (fp_mode) {
92 case SaveFPRegsMode::kIgnore:
93 return Builtin::kRecordWriteIgnoreFP;
94 case SaveFPRegsMode::kSave:
95 return Builtin::kRecordWriteSaveFP;
96 }
97 }
98
99#ifdef V8_IS_TSAN
100 static Builtin GetTSANStoreBuiltin(SaveFPRegsMode fp_mode, int size,
101 std::memory_order order) {
102 if (order == std::memory_order_relaxed) {
103 if (size == kInt8Size) {
104 return fp_mode == SaveFPRegsMode::kIgnore
105 ? Builtin::kTSANRelaxedStore8IgnoreFP
106 : Builtin::kTSANRelaxedStore8SaveFP;
107 } else if (size == kInt16Size) {
108 return fp_mode == SaveFPRegsMode::kIgnore
109 ? Builtin::kTSANRelaxedStore16IgnoreFP
110 : Builtin::kTSANRelaxedStore16SaveFP;
111 } else if (size == kInt32Size) {
112 return fp_mode == SaveFPRegsMode::kIgnore
113 ? Builtin::kTSANRelaxedStore32IgnoreFP
114 : Builtin::kTSANRelaxedStore32SaveFP;
115 } else {
116 CHECK_EQ(size, kInt64Size);
117 return fp_mode == SaveFPRegsMode::kIgnore
118 ? Builtin::kTSANRelaxedStore64IgnoreFP
119 : Builtin::kTSANRelaxedStore64SaveFP;
120 }
121 } else {
122 DCHECK_EQ(order, std::memory_order_seq_cst);
123 if (size == kInt8Size) {
124 return fp_mode == SaveFPRegsMode::kIgnore
125 ? Builtin::kTSANSeqCstStore8IgnoreFP
126 : Builtin::kTSANSeqCstStore8SaveFP;
127 } else if (size == kInt16Size) {
128 return fp_mode == SaveFPRegsMode::kIgnore
129 ? Builtin::kTSANSeqCstStore16IgnoreFP
130 : Builtin::kTSANSeqCstStore16SaveFP;
131 } else if (size == kInt32Size) {
132 return fp_mode == SaveFPRegsMode::kIgnore
133 ? Builtin::kTSANSeqCstStore32IgnoreFP
134 : Builtin::kTSANSeqCstStore32SaveFP;
135 } else {
136 CHECK_EQ(size, kInt64Size);
137 return fp_mode == SaveFPRegsMode::kIgnore
138 ? Builtin::kTSANSeqCstStore64IgnoreFP
139 : Builtin::kTSANSeqCstStore64SaveFP;
140 }
141 }
142 }
143
144 static Builtin GetTSANRelaxedLoadBuiltin(SaveFPRegsMode fp_mode, int size) {
145 if (size == kInt32Size) {
146 return fp_mode == SaveFPRegsMode::kIgnore
147 ? Builtin::kTSANRelaxedLoad32IgnoreFP
148 : Builtin::kTSANRelaxedLoad32SaveFP;
149 } else {
150 CHECK_EQ(size, kInt64Size);
151 return fp_mode == SaveFPRegsMode::kIgnore
152 ? Builtin::kTSANRelaxedLoad64IgnoreFP
153 : Builtin::kTSANRelaxedLoad64SaveFP;
154 }
155 }
156#endif // V8_IS_TSAN
157
158 base::Vector<uint8_t> instructions() const {
159 return base::VectorOf(instructions_,
160 static_cast<size_t>(instructions_size_));
161 }
162 Address instruction_start() const {
163 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(instructions_);
164 }
165 size_t instructions_size() const {
166 return static_cast<size_t>(instructions_size_);
167 }
168 base::Vector<const uint8_t> reloc_info() const {
169 return {protected_instructions_data().end(),
170 static_cast<size_t>(reloc_info_size_)};
171 }
172 base::Vector<const uint8_t> source_positions() const {
173 return {reloc_info().end(), static_cast<size_t>(source_positions_size_)};
174 }
175 base::Vector<const uint8_t> inlining_positions() const {
176 return {source_positions().end(),
177 static_cast<size_t>(inlining_positions_size_)};
178 }
179 base::Vector<const uint8_t> deopt_data() const {
180 return {inlining_positions().end(), static_cast<size_t>(deopt_data_size_)};
181 }
182
183 int index() const { return index_; }
184 // Anonymous functions are functions that don't carry an index.
185 bool IsAnonymous() const { return index_ == kAnonymousFuncIndex; }
186 Kind kind() const { return KindField::decode(flags_); }
187 NativeModule* native_module() const { return native_module_; }
188 ExecutionTier tier() const { return ExecutionTierField::decode(flags_); }
189 Address constant_pool() const;
190 Address handler_table() const;
191 int handler_table_size() const;
192 Address code_comments() const;
193 int code_comments_size() const;
194 int constant_pool_offset() const { return constant_pool_offset_; }
195 int safepoint_table_offset() const { return safepoint_table_offset_; }
196 int handler_table_offset() const { return handler_table_offset_; }
197 int code_comments_offset() const { return code_comments_offset_; }
198 int unpadded_binary_size() const { return unpadded_binary_size_; }
199 int stack_slots() const { return stack_slots_; }
200 int ool_spills() const { return ool_spills_; }
201 uint16_t first_tagged_parameter_slot() const {
202 return tagged_parameter_slots_ >> 16;
203 }
204 uint16_t num_tagged_parameter_slots() const {
205 return tagged_parameter_slots_ & 0xFFFF;
206 }
207 uint32_t raw_tagged_parameter_slots_for_serialization() const {
208 return tagged_parameter_slots_;
209 }
210
211 bool is_liftoff() const { return tier() == ExecutionTier::kLiftoff; }
212
213 bool is_turbofan() const { return tier() == ExecutionTier::kTurbofan; }
214
215 bool contains(Address pc) const {
216 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(instructions_) <= pc &&
217 pc < reinterpret_cast<Address>(instructions_ + instructions_size_);
218 }
219
220 // Only Liftoff code that was generated for debugging can be inspected
221 // (otherwise debug side table positions would not match up).
222 bool is_inspectable() const { return is_liftoff() && for_debugging(); }
223
224 base::Vector<const uint8_t> protected_instructions_data() const {
225 return {meta_data_.get(),
226 static_cast<size_t>(protected_instructions_size_)};
227 }
228
229 base::Vector<const trap_handler::ProtectedInstructionData>
230 protected_instructions() const {
231 return base::Vector<const trap_handler::ProtectedInstructionData>::cast(
232 protected_instructions_data());
233 }
234
235 bool IsProtectedInstruction(Address pc);
236
237 void Validate() const;
238 void Print(const char* name = nullptr) const;
239 void MaybePrint() const;
240 void Disassemble(const char* name, std::ostream& os,
241 Address current_pc = kNullAddress) const;
242
243 static bool ShouldBeLogged(Isolate* isolate);
244 void LogCode(Isolate* isolate, const char* source_url, int script_id) const;
245
246 WasmCode(const WasmCode&) = delete;
247 WasmCode& operator=(const WasmCode&) = delete;
248 ~WasmCode();
249
250 void IncRef() {
251 [[maybe_unused]] int old_val =
252 ref_count_.fetch_add(1, std::memory_order_acq_rel);
253 DCHECK_LE(1, old_val);
254 DCHECK_GT(kMaxInt, old_val);
255 }
256
257 // Decrement the ref count. Returns whether this code becomes dead and needs
258 // to be freed.
259 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT bool DecRef() {
260 int old_count = ref_count_.load(std::memory_order_acquire);
261 while (true) {
262 DCHECK_LE(1, old_count);
263 if (V8_UNLIKELY(old_count == 1)) return DecRefOnPotentiallyDeadCode();
264 if (ref_count_.compare_exchange_weak(old_count, old_count - 1,
265 std::memory_order_acq_rel)) {
266 return false;
267 }
268 }
269 }
270
271 // Decrement the ref count on code that is known to be in use (i.e. the ref
272 // count cannot drop to zero here).
273 void DecRefOnLiveCode() {
274 [[maybe_unused]] int old_count =
275 ref_count_.fetch_sub(1, std::memory_order_acq_rel);
276 DCHECK_LE(2, old_count);
277 }
278
279 // Decrement the ref count on code that is known to be dead, even though there
280 // might still be C++ references. Returns whether this drops the last
281 // reference and the code needs to be freed.
282 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT bool DecRefOnDeadCode() {
283 return ref_count_.fetch_sub(1, std::memory_order_acq_rel) == 1;
284 }
285
286 // Decrement the ref count on a set of {WasmCode} objects, potentially
287 // belonging to different {NativeModule}s. Dead code will be deleted.
288 static void DecrementRefCount(base::Vector<WasmCode* const>);
289
290 // Returns the last source position before {offset}.
291 SourcePosition GetSourcePositionBefore(int code_offset);
292 int GetSourceOffsetBefore(int code_offset);
293
294 std::tuple<int, bool, SourcePosition> GetInliningPosition(
295 int inlining_id) const;
296
297 // Returns whether this code was generated for debugging. If this returns
298 // {kForDebugging}, but {tier()} is not {kLiftoff}, then Liftoff compilation
299 // bailed out.
300 ForDebugging for_debugging() const {
301 return ForDebuggingField::decode(flags_);
302 }
303
304 // Returns {true} for Liftoff code that sets up a feedback vector slot in its
305 // stack frame.
306 // TODO(jkummerow): This can be dropped when we ship Wasm inlining.
307 bool frame_has_feedback_slot() const {
308 return FrameHasFeedbackSlotField::decode(flags_);
309 }
310
311 enum FlushICache : bool { kFlushICache = true, kNoFlushICache = false };
312
313 size_t EstimateCurrentMemoryConsumption() const;
314
315 // Tries to get a reasonable name. Lazily looks up the name section, and falls
316 // back to the function index. Return value is guaranteed to not be empty.
317 std::string DebugName() const;
318
319 private:
320 friend class NativeModule;
321
322 WasmCode(NativeModule* native_module, int index,
323 base::Vector<uint8_t> instructions, int stack_slots, int ool_spills,
324 uint32_t tagged_parameter_slots, int safepoint_table_offset,
325 int handler_table_offset, int constant_pool_offset,
326 int code_comments_offset, int unpadded_binary_size,
327 base::Vector<const uint8_t> protected_instructions_data,
328 base::Vector<const uint8_t> reloc_info,
329 base::Vector<const uint8_t> source_position_table,
330 base::Vector<const uint8_t> inlining_positions,
331 base::Vector<const uint8_t> deopt_data, Kind kind,
332 ExecutionTier tier, ForDebugging for_debugging,
333 bool frame_has_feedback_slot = false)
334 : native_module_(native_module),
335 instructions_(instructions.begin()),
336 meta_data_(ConcatenateBytes({protected_instructions_data, reloc_info,
337 source_position_table, inlining_positions,
338 deopt_data})),
339 instructions_size_(instructions.length()),
340 reloc_info_size_(reloc_info.length()),
341 source_positions_size_(source_position_table.length()),
342 inlining_positions_size_(inlining_positions.length()),
343 deopt_data_size_(deopt_data.length()),
344 protected_instructions_size_(protected_instructions_data.length()),
345 index_(index),
346 constant_pool_offset_(constant_pool_offset),
347 stack_slots_(stack_slots),
348 ool_spills_(ool_spills),
349 tagged_parameter_slots_(tagged_parameter_slots),
350 safepoint_table_offset_(safepoint_table_offset),
351 handler_table_offset_(handler_table_offset),
352 code_comments_offset_(code_comments_offset),
353 unpadded_binary_size_(unpadded_binary_size),
354 flags_(KindField::encode(kind) | ExecutionTierField::encode(tier) |
355 ForDebuggingField::encode(for_debugging) |
356 FrameHasFeedbackSlotField::encode(frame_has_feedback_slot)) {
357 DCHECK_LE(safepoint_table_offset, unpadded_binary_size);
358 DCHECK_LE(handler_table_offset, unpadded_binary_size);
359 DCHECK_LE(code_comments_offset, unpadded_binary_size);
360 DCHECK_LE(constant_pool_offset, unpadded_binary_size);
361 }
362
363 std::unique_ptr<const uint8_t[]> ConcatenateBytes(
364 std::initializer_list<base::Vector<const uint8_t>>);
365
366 // Code objects that have been registered with the global trap
367 // handler within this process, will have a {trap_handler_index} associated
368 // with them.
369 int trap_handler_index() const {
370 CHECK(has_trap_handler_index());
371 return trap_handler_index_;
372 }
373 void set_trap_handler_index(int value) {
374 CHECK(!has_trap_handler_index());
375 trap_handler_index_ = value;
376 }
377 bool has_trap_handler_index() const { return trap_handler_index_ >= 0; }
378
379 // Register protected instruction information with the trap handler. Sets
380 // trap_handler_index.
381 void RegisterTrapHandlerData();
382
383 // Slow path for {DecRef}: The code becomes potentially dead.
384 // Returns whether this code becomes dead and needs to be freed.
385 V8_NOINLINE bool DecRefOnPotentiallyDeadCode();
386
387 NativeModule* const native_module_ = nullptr;
388 uint8_t* const instructions_;
389 // {meta_data_} contains several byte vectors concatenated into one:
390 // - protected instructions data of size {protected_instructions_size_}
391 // - relocation info of size {reloc_info_size_}
392 // - source positions of size {source_positions_size_}
393 // - deopt data of size {deopt_data_size_}
394 // Note that the protected instructions come first to ensure alignment.
395 std::unique_ptr<const uint8_t[]> meta_data_;
396 const int instructions_size_;
397 const int reloc_info_size_;
398 const int source_positions_size_;
399 const int inlining_positions_size_;
400 const int deopt_data_size_;
401 const int protected_instructions_size_;
402 const int index_; // The wasm function-index within the module.
403 const int constant_pool_offset_;
404 const int stack_slots_;
405 const int ool_spills_;
406 // Number and position of tagged parameters passed to this function via the
407 // stack, packed into a single uint32. These values are used by the stack
408 // walker (e.g. GC) to find references.
409 const uint32_t tagged_parameter_slots_;
410 // We care about safepoint data for wasm-to-js functions, since there may be
411 // stack/register tagged values for large number conversions.
412 const int safepoint_table_offset_;
413 const int handler_table_offset_;
414 const int code_comments_offset_;
415 const int unpadded_binary_size_;
416 int trap_handler_index_ = -1;
417
418 const uint8_t flags_; // Bit field, see below.
419 // Bits encoded in {flags_}:
420 using KindField = base::BitField8<Kind, 0, 2>;
421 using ExecutionTierField = KindField::Next<ExecutionTier, 2>;
422 using ForDebuggingField = ExecutionTierField::Next<ForDebugging, 2>;
423 using FrameHasFeedbackSlotField = ForDebuggingField::Next<bool, 1>;
424
425 // WasmCode is ref counted. Counters are held by:
426 // 1) The jump table / code table.
427 // 2) {WasmCodeRefScope}s.
428 // 3) The set of potentially dead code in the {WasmEngine}.
429 // If a decrement of (1) would drop the ref count to 0, that code becomes a
430 // candidate for garbage collection. At that point, we add a ref count for (3)
431 // *before* decrementing the counter to ensure the code stays alive as long as
432 // it's being used. Once the ref count drops to zero (i.e. after being removed
433 // from (3) and all (2)), the code object is deleted and the memory for the
434 // machine code is freed.
435 std::atomic<int> ref_count_{1};
436};
437
438WasmCode::Kind GetCodeKind(const WasmCompilationResult& result);
439
440// Return a textual description of the kind.
441const char* GetWasmCodeKindAsString(WasmCode::Kind);
442
443// Manages the code reservations and allocations of a single {NativeModule}.
444class WasmCodeAllocator {
445 public:
446 explicit WasmCodeAllocator(std::shared_ptr<Counters> async_counters);
447 ~WasmCodeAllocator();
448
449 // Call before use, after the {NativeModule} is set up completely.
450 void Init(VirtualMemory code_space);
451
452 size_t committed_code_space() const {
453 return committed_code_space_.load(std::memory_order_acquire);
454 }
455 size_t generated_code_size() const {
456 return generated_code_size_.load(std::memory_order_acquire);
457 }
458 size_t freed_code_size() const {
459 return freed_code_size_.load(std::memory_order_acquire);
460 }
461
462 // Allocate code space. Returns a valid buffer or fails with OOM (crash).
463 // Hold the {NativeModule}'s {allocation_mutex_} when calling this method.
464 base::Vector<uint8_t> AllocateForCode(NativeModule*, size_t size);
465
466 // Allocate code space within a specific region. Returns a valid buffer or
467 // fails with OOM (crash).
468 // Hold the {NativeModule}'s {allocation_mutex_} when calling this method.
469 base::Vector<uint8_t> AllocateForCodeInRegion(NativeModule*, size_t size,
470 base::AddressRegion);
471
472 // Free memory pages of all given code objects. Used for wasm code GC.
473 // Hold the {NativeModule}'s {allocation_mutex_} when calling this method.
474 void FreeCode(base::Vector<WasmCode* const>);
475
476 // Retrieve the number of separately reserved code spaces.
477 // Hold the {NativeModule}'s {allocation_mutex_} when calling this method.
478 size_t GetNumCodeSpaces() const;
479
480 Counters* counters() const { return async_counters_.get(); }
481
482 private:
484 // These fields are protected by the mutex in {NativeModule}.
485
486 // Code space that was reserved and is available for allocations
487 // (subset of {owned_code_space_}).
488 DisjointAllocationPool free_code_space_;
489 // Code space that was allocated before but is dead now. Full
490 // pages within this region are discarded. It's still a subset of
491 // {owned_code_space_}.
492 DisjointAllocationPool freed_code_space_;
493 std::vector<VirtualMemory> owned_code_space_;
494
495 // End of fields protected by {mutex_}.
497
498 std::atomic<size_t> committed_code_space_{0};
499 std::atomic<size_t> generated_code_size_{0};
500 std::atomic<size_t> freed_code_size_{0};
501
502 std::shared_ptr<Counters> async_counters_;
503};
504
505class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE NativeModule final {
506 public:
507 static constexpr ExternalPointerTag kManagedTag = kWasmNativeModuleTag;
508
509#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_X64 || V8_TARGET_ARCH_S390X || V8_TARGET_ARCH_ARM64 || \
510 V8_TARGET_ARCH_PPC64 || V8_TARGET_ARCH_LOONG64 || V8_TARGET_ARCH_RISCV64
511 static constexpr bool kNeedsFarJumpsBetweenCodeSpaces = true;
512#else
513 static constexpr bool kNeedsFarJumpsBetweenCodeSpaces = false;
514#endif
515
516 NativeModule(const NativeModule&) = delete;
517 NativeModule& operator=(const NativeModule&) = delete;
518 ~NativeModule();
519
520 // {AddCode} is thread safe w.r.t. other calls to {AddCode} or methods adding
521 // code below, i.e. it can be called concurrently from background threads.
522 // The returned code still needs to be published via {PublishCode}.
523 std::unique_ptr<WasmCode> AddCode(
524 int index, const CodeDesc& desc, int stack_slots, int ool_spill_count,
525 uint32_t tagged_parameter_slots,
526 base::Vector<const uint8_t> protected_instructions,
527 base::Vector<const uint8_t> source_position_table,
528 base::Vector<const uint8_t> inlining_positions,
529 base::Vector<const uint8_t> deopt_data, WasmCode::Kind kind,
530 ExecutionTier tier, ForDebugging for_debugging);
531
532 // {PublishCode} makes the code available to the system by entering it into
533 // the code table and patching the jump table. It returns a raw pointer to the
534 // given {WasmCode} object. Ownership is transferred to the {NativeModule}.
535 // Returns {nullptr} if the {AssumptionsJournal} is non-nullptr and contains
536 // invalid assumptions.
537 WasmCode* PublishCode(std::unique_ptr<WasmCode>,
538 AssumptionsJournal* = nullptr);
539 std::vector<WasmCode*> PublishCode(base::Vector<std::unique_ptr<WasmCode>>);
540
541 // ReinstallDebugCode does a subset of PublishCode: It installs the code in
542 // the code table and patches the jump table. The given code must be debug
543 // code (with breakpoints) and must be owned by this {NativeModule} already.
544 // This method is used to re-instantiate code that was removed from the code
545 // table and jump table via another {PublishCode}.
546 void ReinstallDebugCode(WasmCode*);
547
548 struct JumpTablesRef {
549 Address jump_table_start = kNullAddress;
550 Address far_jump_table_start = kNullAddress;
551
552 bool is_valid() const { return far_jump_table_start != kNullAddress; }
553 };
554
555 std::pair<base::Vector<uint8_t>, JumpTablesRef> AllocateForDeserializedCode(
556 size_t total_code_size);
557
558 std::unique_ptr<WasmCode> AddDeserializedCode(
559 int index, base::Vector<uint8_t> instructions, int stack_slots,
560 int ool_spills, uint32_t tagged_parameter_slots,
561 int safepoint_table_offset, int handler_table_offset,
562 int constant_pool_offset, int code_comments_offset,
563 int unpadded_binary_size,
564 base::Vector<const uint8_t> protected_instructions_data,
565 base::Vector<const uint8_t> reloc_info,
566 base::Vector<const uint8_t> source_position_table,
567 base::Vector<const uint8_t> inlining_positions,
568 base::Vector<const uint8_t> deopt_data, WasmCode::Kind kind,
569 ExecutionTier tier);
570
571 // Adds anonymous code for testing purposes.
572 WasmCode* AddCodeForTesting(Handle<Code> code);
573
574 // Allocates and initializes the {lazy_compile_table_} and initializes the
575 // first jump table with jumps to the {lazy_compile_table_}.
576 void InitializeJumpTableForLazyCompilation(uint32_t num_wasm_functions);
577
578 // Use {UseLazyStubLocked} to setup lazy compilation per function. It will use
579 // the existing {WasmCode::kWasmCompileLazy} runtime stub and populate the
580 // jump table with trampolines accordingly.
581 void UseLazyStubLocked(uint32_t func_index);
582
583 // Creates a snapshot of the current state of the code table, along with the
584 // current import statuses that these code objects depend on. This is useful
585 // to get a consistent view of the table (e.g. used by the serializer).
586 std::pair<std::vector<WasmCode*>, std::vector<WellKnownImport>>
587 SnapshotCodeTable() const;
588 // Creates a snapshot of all {owned_code_}, will transfer new code (if any) to
589 // {owned_code_}.
590 std::vector<WasmCode*> SnapshotAllOwnedCode() const;
591
592 WasmCode* GetCode(uint32_t index) const;
593 bool HasCode(uint32_t index) const;
594 bool HasCodeWithTier(uint32_t index, ExecutionTier tier) const;
595
596 void SetWasmSourceMap(std::unique_ptr<WasmModuleSourceMap> source_map);
597 WasmModuleSourceMap* GetWasmSourceMap() const;
598
599 Address jump_table_start() const {
600 return main_jump_table_ ? main_jump_table_->instruction_start()
601 : kNullAddress;
602 }
603
604 // Get the call target in the jump table previously looked up via
605 // {FindJumpTablesForRegionLocked}.
606 Address GetNearCallTargetForFunction(uint32_t func_index,
607 const JumpTablesRef&) const;
608
609 // Get the slot offset in the far jump table that jumps to the given builtin.
610 Address GetJumpTableEntryForBuiltin(Builtin builtin,
611 const JumpTablesRef&) const;
612
613 // Reverse lookup from a given call target (which must be a jump table slot)
614 // to a function index.
615 uint32_t GetFunctionIndexFromJumpTableSlot(Address slot_address) const;
616
617 // For cctests, where we build both WasmModule and the runtime objects
618 // on the fly, and bypass the instance builder pipeline.
619 void ReserveCodeTableForTesting(uint32_t max_functions);
620
621 // Log all owned code in the given isolate, using the given script as the
622 // containing script. Use this after transferring the module to a new isolate
623 // or when enabling a component that needs all code to be logged (profiler).
624 void LogWasmCodes(Isolate*, Tagged<Script>);
625
626 CompilationState* compilation_state() const {
627 return compilation_state_.get();
628 }
629
630 uint32_t num_functions() const {
631 return module_->num_declared_functions + module_->num_imported_functions;
632 }
633 uint32_t num_imported_functions() const {
634 return module_->num_imported_functions;
635 }
636 void set_lazy_compile_frozen(bool frozen) { lazy_compile_frozen_ = frozen; }
637 bool lazy_compile_frozen() const { return lazy_compile_frozen_; }
638 base::Vector<const uint8_t> wire_bytes() const {
639 return std::atomic_load(&wire_bytes_)->as_vector();
640 }
641 const WasmModule* module() const { return module_.get(); }
642 std::shared_ptr<const WasmModule> shared_module() const { return module_; }
643 size_t committed_code_space() const {
644 return code_allocator_.committed_code_space();
645 }
646 size_t generated_code_size() const {
647 return code_allocator_.generated_code_size();
648 }
649 size_t liftoff_bailout_count() const {
650 return liftoff_bailout_count_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
651 }
652 size_t liftoff_code_size() const {
653 return liftoff_code_size_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
654 }
655 size_t turbofan_code_size() const {
656 return turbofan_code_size_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
657 }
658
659 void AddLazyCompilationTimeSample(int64_t sample);
660
661 int num_lazy_compilations() const {
662 return num_lazy_compilations_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
663 }
664
665 int64_t sum_lazy_compilation_time_in_ms() const {
666 return sum_lazy_compilation_time_in_micro_sec_.load(
667 std::memory_order_relaxed) /
668 1000;
669 }
670
671 int64_t max_lazy_compilation_time_in_ms() const {
672 return max_lazy_compilation_time_in_micro_sec_.load(
673 std::memory_order_relaxed) /
674 1000;
675 }
676
677 // To avoid double-reporting, only the first instantiation should report lazy
678 // compilation performance metrics.
679 bool ShouldLazyCompilationMetricsBeReported() {
680 return should_metrics_be_reported_.exchange(false,
681 std::memory_order_relaxed);
682 }
683
684 // Similar to above, scheduling a repeated task to write out PGO data is only
685 // needed once per module, not per instantiation.
686 bool ShouldPgoDataBeWritten() {
687 return should_pgo_data_be_written_.exchange(false,
688 std::memory_order_relaxed);
689 }
690
691 bool HasWireBytes() const {
692 auto wire_bytes = std::atomic_load(&wire_bytes_);
693 return wire_bytes && !wire_bytes->empty();
694 }
695 void SetWireBytes(base::OwnedVector<const uint8_t> wire_bytes);
696
697 void AddLiftoffBailout() {
698 liftoff_bailout_count_.fetch_add(1, std::memory_order_relaxed);
699 }
700
701 WasmCode* Lookup(Address) const;
702
703 WasmImportWrapperCache* import_wrapper_cache() {
704 return &import_wrapper_cache_;
705 }
706
707 WasmFeatures enabled_features() const { return enabled_features_; }
708 CompileTimeImports compile_imports() const { return compile_imports_; }
709
710 // Returns the builtin that corresponds to the given address (which
711 // must be a far jump table slot). Returns {kNoBuiltinId} on failure.
712 Builtin GetBuiltinInJumptableSlot(Address target) const;
713
714 // Sample the current code size of this modules to the given counters.
715 void SampleCodeSize(Counters*) const;
716
717 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT std::unique_ptr<WasmCode> AddCompiledCode(
718 const WasmCompilationResult&);
719 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT std::vector<std::unique_ptr<WasmCode>> AddCompiledCode(
720 base::Vector<const WasmCompilationResult>);
721
722 // Set a new debugging state, but don't trigger any recompilation;
723 // recompilation happens lazily.
724 void SetDebugState(DebugState);
725
726 // Check whether this modules is in debug state.
727 DebugState IsInDebugState() const {
728 base::RecursiveMutexGuard lock(&allocation_mutex_);
729 return debug_state_;
730 }
731
732 enum class RemoveFilter {
733 kRemoveDebugCode,
734 kRemoveNonDebugCode,
735 kRemoveLiftoffCode,
736 kRemoveTurbofanCode,
737 kRemoveAllCode,
738 };
739 // Remove all compiled code from the {NativeModule} and replace it with
740 // {CompileLazy} builtins.
741 void RemoveCompiledCode(RemoveFilter filter);
742
743 // Returns the code size of all Liftoff compiled functions.
744 size_t SumLiftoffCodeSize();
745
746 // Free a set of functions of this module. Uncommits whole pages if possible.
747 // The given vector must be ordered by the instruction start address, and all
748 // {WasmCode} objects must not be used any more.
749 // Should only be called via {WasmEngine::FreeDeadCode}, so the engine can do
750 // its accounting.
751 void FreeCode(base::Vector<WasmCode* const>);
752
753 // Retrieve the number of separately reserved code spaces for this module.
754 size_t GetNumberOfCodeSpacesForTesting() const;
755
756 // Check whether there is DebugInfo for this NativeModule.
757 bool HasDebugInfo() const;
758
759 // Get or create the debug info for this NativeModule.
760 DebugInfo* GetDebugInfo();
761
762 // Get or create the NamesProvider. Requires {HasWireBytes()}.
763 NamesProvider* GetNamesProvider();
764
765 uint32_t* tiering_budget_array() const { return tiering_budgets_.get(); }
766
767 Counters* counters() const { return code_allocator_.counters(); }
768
769 size_t EstimateCurrentMemoryConsumption() const;
770
771 bool log_code() const { return log_code_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed); }
772
773 void EnableCodeLogging() { log_code_.store(true, std::memory_order_relaxed); }
774
775 void DisableCodeLogging() {
776 log_code_.store(false, std::memory_order_relaxed);
777 }
778
779 enum class JumpTableType {
780 kJumpTable,
781 kFarJumpTable,
782 kLazyCompileTable,
783 };
784
785 bool TrySetFastApiCallTarget(int index, Address target) {
786 Address old_val = fast_api_targets_[index].load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
787 if (old_val == target) {
788 return true;
789 }
790 if (old_val != kNullAddress) {
791 // If already a different target is stored, then there are conflicting
792 // targets and fast api calls are not possible.
793 return false;
794 }
795 return fast_api_targets_[index].compare_exchange_weak(
796 old_val, target, std::memory_order_relaxed);
797 }
798
799 std::atomic<Address>* fast_api_targets() const {
800 return fast_api_targets_.get();
801 }
802
803 void set_fast_api_return_is_bool(int index, bool return_is_bool) {
804 fast_api_return_is_bool_[index] = return_is_bool;
805 }
806
807 std::atomic<bool>* fast_api_return_is_bool() const {
808 return fast_api_return_is_bool_.get();
809 }
810
811 private:
812 friend class WasmCode;
813 friend class WasmCodeAllocator;
814 friend class WasmCodeManager;
815 friend class CodeSpaceWriteScope;
816
817 struct CodeSpaceData {
818 base::AddressRegion region;
819 WasmCode* jump_table;
820 WasmCode* far_jump_table;
821 };
822
823 // Private constructor, called via {WasmCodeManager::NewNativeModule()}.
824 NativeModule(WasmFeatures enabled_features,
825 CompileTimeImports compile_imports,
826 DynamicTiering dynamic_tiering, VirtualMemory code_space,
827 std::shared_ptr<const WasmModule> module,
828 std::shared_ptr<Counters> async_counters,
829 std::shared_ptr<NativeModule>* shared_this);
830
831 std::unique_ptr<WasmCode> AddCodeWithCodeSpace(
832 int index, const CodeDesc& desc, int stack_slots, int ool_spill_count,
833 uint32_t tagged_parameter_slots,
834 base::Vector<const uint8_t> protected_instructions_data,
835 base::Vector<const uint8_t> source_position_table,
836 base::Vector<const uint8_t> inlining_positions,
837 base::Vector<const uint8_t> deopt_data, WasmCode::Kind kind,
838 ExecutionTier tier, ForDebugging for_debugging,
839 bool frame_has_feedback_slot, base::Vector<uint8_t> code_space,
840 const JumpTablesRef& jump_tables_ref);
841
842 WasmCode* CreateEmptyJumpTableLocked(int jump_table_size, JumpTableType type);
843
844 WasmCode* CreateEmptyJumpTableInRegionLocked(int jump_table_size,
845 base::AddressRegion,
846 JumpTableType type);
847
848 // Finds the jump tables that should be used for given code region. This
849 // information is then passed to {GetNearCallTargetForFunction} and
850 // {GetNearRuntimeStubEntry} to avoid the overhead of looking this information
851 // up there. Return an empty struct if no suitable jump tables exist.
852 JumpTablesRef FindJumpTablesForRegionLocked(base::AddressRegion) const;
853
854 void UpdateCodeSize(size_t, ExecutionTier, ForDebugging);
855
856 // Hold the {allocation_mutex_} when calling one of these methods.
857 // {slot_index} is the index in the declared functions, i.e. function index
858 // minus the number of imported functions.
859 void PatchJumpTablesLocked(uint32_t slot_index, Address target);
860 void PatchJumpTableLocked(const CodeSpaceData&, uint32_t slot_index,
861 Address target);
862
863 // Called by the {WasmCodeAllocator} to register a new code space.
864 void AddCodeSpaceLocked(base::AddressRegion);
865
866 // Hold the {allocation_mutex_} when calling {PublishCodeLocked}.
867 WasmCode* PublishCodeLocked(std::unique_ptr<WasmCode>);
868
869 // Transfer owned code from {new_owned_code_} to {owned_code_}.
870 void TransferNewOwnedCodeLocked() const;
871
872 // Add code to the code cache, if it meets criteria for being cached and we do
873 // not have code in the cache yet.
874 void InsertToCodeCache(WasmCode* code);
875
876 bool should_update_code_table(WasmCode* new_code, WasmCode* prior_code) const;
877
878 // -- Fields of {NativeModule} start here.
879
880 // Keep the engine alive as long as this NativeModule is alive. In its
881 // destructor, the NativeModule still communicates with the WasmCodeManager,
882 // owned by the engine. This fields comes before other fields which also still
883 // access the engine (like the code allocator), so that it's destructor runs
884 // last.
885 OperationsBarrier::Token engine_scope_;
886
887 // {WasmCodeAllocator} manages all code reservations and allocations for this
888 // {NativeModule}.
889 WasmCodeAllocator code_allocator_;
890
891 // Features enabled for this module. We keep a copy of the features that
892 // were enabled at the time of the creation of this native module,
893 // to be consistent across asynchronous compilations later.
894 const WasmFeatures enabled_features_;
895
896 // Compile-time imports requested for this module.
897 const CompileTimeImports compile_imports_;
898
899 // The decoded module, stored in a shared_ptr such that background compile
900 // tasks can keep this alive.
901 std::shared_ptr<const WasmModule> module_;
902
903 std::unique_ptr<WasmModuleSourceMap> source_map_;
904
905 // Wire bytes, held in a shared_ptr so they can be kept alive by the
906 // {WireBytesStorage}, held by background compile tasks.
907 std::shared_ptr<base::OwnedVector<const uint8_t>> wire_bytes_;
908
909 // The first allocated jump table. Always used by external calls (from JS).
910 // Wasm calls might use one of the other jump tables stored in
911 // {code_space_data_}.
912 WasmCode* main_jump_table_ = nullptr;
913
914 // The first allocated far jump table.
915 WasmCode* main_far_jump_table_ = nullptr;
916
917 // Lazy compile stub table, containing entries to jump to the
918 // {WasmCompileLazy} builtin, passing the function index.
919 WasmCode* lazy_compile_table_ = nullptr;
920
921 // The compilation state keeps track of compilation tasks for this module.
922 // Note that its destructor blocks until all tasks are finished/aborted and
923 // hence needs to be destructed first when this native module dies.
924 std::unique_ptr<CompilationState> compilation_state_;
925
926 // A cache of the import wrappers, keyed on the kind and signature.
927 WasmImportWrapperCache import_wrapper_cache_;
928
929 // Array to handle number of function calls.
930 std::unique_ptr<uint32_t[]> tiering_budgets_;
931
932 // This mutex protects concurrent calls to {AddCode} and friends.
933 // TODO(dlehmann): Revert this to a regular {Mutex} again.
934 // This needs to be a {RecursiveMutex} only because of {CodeSpaceWriteScope}
935 // usages, which are (1) either at places that already hold the
936 // {allocation_mutex_} or (2) because of multiple open {CodeSpaceWriteScope}s
937 // in the call hierarchy. Both are fixable.
938 mutable base::RecursiveMutex allocation_mutex_;
939
941 // Protected by {allocation_mutex_}:
942
943 // Holds allocated code objects for fast lookup and deletion. For lookup based
944 // on pc, the key is the instruction start address of the value. Filled lazily
945 // from {new_owned_code_} (below).
946 mutable std::map<Address, std::unique_ptr<WasmCode>> owned_code_;
947
948 // Holds owned code which is not inserted into {owned_code_} yet. It will be
949 // inserted on demand. This has much better performance than inserting
950 // individual code objects.
951 mutable std::vector<std::unique_ptr<WasmCode>> new_owned_code_;
952
953 // Table of the latest code object per function, updated on initial
954 // compilation and tier up. The number of entries is
955 // {WasmModule::num_declared_functions}, i.e. there are no entries for
956 // imported functions.
957 std::unique_ptr<WasmCode*[]> code_table_;
958
959 // Data (especially jump table) per code space.
960 std::vector<CodeSpaceData> code_space_data_;
961
962 // Debug information for this module. You only need to hold the allocation
963 // mutex while getting the {DebugInfo} pointer, or initializing this field.
964 // Further accesses to the {DebugInfo} do not need to be protected by the
965 // mutex.
966 std::unique_ptr<DebugInfo> debug_info_;
967
968 std::unique_ptr<NamesProvider> names_provider_;
969
970 DebugState debug_state_ = kNotDebugging;
971
972 // Cache both baseline and top-tier code if we are debugging, to speed up
973 // repeated enabling/disabling of the debugger or profiler.
974 // Maps <tier, function_index> to WasmCode.
975 std::unique_ptr<std::map<std::pair<ExecutionTier, int>, WasmCode*>>
976 cached_code_;
977
978 // End of fields protected by {allocation_mutex_}.
980
981 bool lazy_compile_frozen_ = false;
982 std::atomic<size_t> liftoff_bailout_count_{0};
983 std::atomic<size_t> liftoff_code_size_{0};
984 std::atomic<size_t> turbofan_code_size_{0};
985
986 // Metrics for lazy compilation.
987 std::atomic<int> num_lazy_compilations_{0};
988 std::atomic<int64_t> sum_lazy_compilation_time_in_micro_sec_{0};
989 std::atomic<int64_t> max_lazy_compilation_time_in_micro_sec_{0};
990 std::atomic<bool> should_metrics_be_reported_{true};
991
992 // Whether the next instantiation should trigger repeated output of PGO data
993 // (if --experimental-wasm-pgo-to-file is enabled).
994 std::atomic<bool> should_pgo_data_be_written_{true};
995
996 // A lock-free quick-access flag to indicate whether code for this
997 // NativeModule might need to be logged in any isolate. This is updated by the
998 // {WasmEngine}, which keeps the source of truth. After checking this flag,
999 // you would typically call into {WasmEngine::LogCode} which then checks
1000 // (under a mutex) which isolate needs logging.
1001 std::atomic<bool> log_code_{false};
1002
1003 std::unique_ptr<std::atomic<Address>[]> fast_api_targets_;
1004 std::unique_ptr<std::atomic<bool>[]> fast_api_return_is_bool_;
1005};
1006
1007class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE WasmCodeManager final {
1008 public:
1009 WasmCodeManager();
1010 WasmCodeManager(const WasmCodeManager&) = delete;
1011 WasmCodeManager& operator=(const WasmCodeManager&) = delete;
1012
1013 ~WasmCodeManager();
1014
1015#if defined(V8_OS_WIN64)
1016 static bool CanRegisterUnwindInfoForNonABICompliantCodeRange();
1017#endif // V8_OS_WIN64
1018
1019 NativeModule* LookupNativeModule(Address pc) const;
1020 // Returns the Wasm code that contains the given address. The result
1021 // is cached. There is one cache per isolate for performance reasons
1022 // (to avoid locking and reference counting). Note that the returned
1023 // value is not reference counted. This should not be an issue since
1024 // we expect that the code is currently being executed. If 'isolate'
1025 // is nullptr, no caching occurs.
1026 WasmCode* LookupCode(Isolate* isolate, Address pc) const;
1027 std::pair<WasmCode*, SafepointEntry> LookupCodeAndSafepoint(Isolate* isolate,
1028 Address pc);
1029 void FlushCodeLookupCache(Isolate* isolate);
1030 size_t committed_code_space() const {
1031 return total_committed_code_space_.load();
1032 }
1033
1034 // Estimate the needed code space for a Liftoff function based on the size of
1035 // the function body (wasm byte code).
1036 static size_t EstimateLiftoffCodeSize(int body_size);
1037 // Estimate the needed code space from a completely decoded module.
1038 static size_t EstimateNativeModuleCodeSize(const WasmModule* module,
1039 bool include_liftoff,
1040 DynamicTiering dynamic_tiering);
1041 // Estimate the needed code space from the number of functions and total code
1042 // section length.
1043 static size_t EstimateNativeModuleCodeSize(int num_functions,
1044 int num_imported_functions,
1045 int code_section_length,
1046 bool include_liftoff,
1047 DynamicTiering dynamic_tiering);
1048 // Estimate the size of meta data needed for the NativeModule, excluding
1049 // generated code. This data still be stored on the C++ heap.
1050 static size_t EstimateNativeModuleMetaDataSize(const WasmModule* module);
1051
1052 // Returns true if there is hardware support for PKU. Use
1053 // {MemoryProtectionKeysEnabled} to also check if PKU usage is enabled via
1054 // flags.
1055 static bool HasMemoryProtectionKeySupport();
1056
1057 // Returns true if PKU should be used.
1058 static bool MemoryProtectionKeysEnabled();
1059
1060 // Returns {true} if the memory protection key is write-enabled for the
1061 // current thread.
1062 // Can only be called if {HasMemoryProtectionKeySupport()} is {true}.
1063 static bool MemoryProtectionKeyWritable();
1064
1065 private:
1066 friend class WasmCodeAllocator;
1067 friend class WasmEngine;
1068 friend class WasmCodeLookupCache;
1069
1070 std::shared_ptr<NativeModule> NewNativeModule(
1071 Isolate* isolate, WasmFeatures enabled_features,
1072 CompileTimeImports compile_imports, size_t code_size_estimate,
1073 std::shared_ptr<const WasmModule> module);
1074
1075 V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT VirtualMemory TryAllocate(size_t size);
1076 void Commit(base::AddressRegion);
1077 void Decommit(base::AddressRegion);
1078
1079 void FreeNativeModule(base::Vector<VirtualMemory> owned_code,
1080 size_t committed_size);
1081
1082 void AssignRange(base::AddressRegion, NativeModule*);
1083
1084 WasmCode* LookupCode(Address pc) const;
1085
1086 const size_t max_committed_code_space_;
1087
1088 std::atomic<size_t> total_committed_code_space_{0};
1089 // If the committed code space exceeds {critical_committed_code_space_}, then
1090 // we trigger a GC before creating the next module. This value is set to the
1091 // currently committed space plus 50% of the available code space on creation
1092 // and updated after each GC.
1093 std::atomic<size_t> critical_committed_code_space_;
1094
1095 mutable base::Mutex native_modules_mutex_;
1096
1098 // Protected by {native_modules_mutex_}:
1099
1100 std::map<Address, std::pair<Address, NativeModule*>> lookup_map_;
1101
1102 // End of fields protected by {native_modules_mutex_}.
1104
1105 // We remember the end address of the last allocated code space and use that
1106 // as a hint for the next code space. As the WasmCodeManager is shared by the
1107 // whole process this ensures that Wasm code spaces are allocated next to each
1108 // other with a high likelyhood. This improves the performance of cross-module
1109 // calls as the branch predictor can only predict indirect call targets within
1110 // a certain range around the call instruction.
1111 std::atomic<Address> next_code_space_hint_;
1112};
1113
1114// {WasmCodeRefScope}s form a perfect stack. New {WasmCode} pointers generated
1115// by e.g. creating new code or looking up code by its address are added to the
1116// top-most {WasmCodeRefScope}.
1117class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE V8_NODISCARD WasmCodeRefScope {
1118 public:
1119 WasmCodeRefScope();
1120 WasmCodeRefScope(const WasmCodeRefScope&) = delete;
1121 WasmCodeRefScope& operator=(const WasmCodeRefScope&) = delete;
1122 ~WasmCodeRefScope();
1123
1124 // Register a {WasmCode} reference in the current {WasmCodeRefScope}. Fails if
1125 // there is no current scope.
1126 static void AddRef(WasmCode*);
1127
1128 private:
1129 WasmCodeRefScope* const previous_scope_;
1130 std::vector<WasmCode*> code_ptrs_;
1131};
1132
1133// Similarly to a global handle, a {GlobalWasmCodeRef} stores a single
1134// ref-counted pointer to a {WasmCode} object.
1135class GlobalWasmCodeRef {
1136 public:
1137 explicit GlobalWasmCodeRef(WasmCode* code,
1138 std::shared_ptr<NativeModule> native_module)
1139 : code_(code), native_module_(std::move(native_module)) {
1140 code_->IncRef();
1141 }
1142
1143 GlobalWasmCodeRef(const GlobalWasmCodeRef&) = delete;
1144 GlobalWasmCodeRef& operator=(const GlobalWasmCodeRef&) = delete;
1145
1146 ~GlobalWasmCodeRef() { WasmCode::DecrementRefCount({&code_, 1}); }
1147
1148 // Get a pointer to the contained {WasmCode} object. This is only guaranteed
1149 // to exist as long as this {GlobalWasmCodeRef} exists.
1150 WasmCode* code() const { return code_; }
1151
1152 private:
1153 WasmCode* const code_;
1154 // Also keep the {NativeModule} alive.
1155 const std::shared_ptr<NativeModule> native_module_;
1156};
1157
1158class WasmCodeLookupCache final {
1159 friend WasmCodeManager;
1160
1161 public:
1162 WasmCodeLookupCache() { Flush(); }
1163
1164 WasmCodeLookupCache(const WasmCodeLookupCache&) = delete;
1165 WasmCodeLookupCache& operator=(const WasmCodeLookupCache&) = delete;
1166
1167 private:
1168 struct CacheEntry {
1169 std::atomic<Address> pc;
1170 wasm::WasmCode* code;
1171 SafepointEntry safepoint_entry;
1172 CacheEntry() : safepoint_entry() {}
1173 };
1174
1175 void Flush();
1176 CacheEntry* GetCacheEntry(Address pc);
1177
1178 static const int kWasmCodeLookupCacheSize = 1024;
1179 CacheEntry cache_[kWasmCodeLookupCacheSize];
1180};
1181

1183} // namespace internal
1184} // namespace v8
